title: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Outside our quarters, Naval Base Singapore 1941
content:
accession_no_csv: 2017-00294-014

  Image: 

  object_work_type: black-and-white photographs

  title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Outside our quarters
 Naval Base Singapore 1941

  physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a group of men sitting on a short flight of steps outside of living quarters. There are six men in the photograph. They are dressed in varied clothing; some are in military uniform with short sleeved collared tops and mid-lengthed pants
 while others are in a vasual singlet and shorts. There are some small tears along the right side of the photograph.

  context_8: armed forces

  sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony
 this collection is part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Outside our quarters, Naval Base Singapore 1941
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a group of men sitting on a short flight of steps outside of living quarters. There are six men in the photograph. They are dressed in varied clothing; some are in military uniform with short sleeved collared tops and mid-lengthed pants, while others are in a vasual singlet and shorts. There are some small tears along the right side of the photograph.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
